response: "{ \"title\": \"Maximum Sum of Three Elements\", \"description\": \"Given an array of integers, find the maximum sum that can be achieved by selecting three distinct elements from the array. The order of elements does not matter.\\n\\n#### Function Signature\\n```python\\ndef max_sum_three_elements(arr: list[int)) -> int:\\n```\\n\\n#### Input\\n- `arr` (list[int]): A list of integers.\\n\\n#### Output\\n- Returns the maximum sum that can be achieved by selecting three distinct elements from the array.\\n\", \"code\": \"def max_sum_three_elements(arr: list[int)) -> int:\\n    # Sort the array in descending order\\n    arr.sort(reverse=True)\\n    # Select the largest three elements and return their sum\\n    return arr[0] + arr[1] + arr[2]\\n\", \"tests\": [\"assert max_sum_three_elements([10, 40, 20, 30]) == 60\", \"assert max_sum_three_elements([-3, -5, 7, 9, 12]) == 23\", \"assert max_sum_three_elements([1, 2, 3, 4, 5]) == 9\"] }"
